intro: Machaonia ottonis, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces fibrous leaves that have been traditionally used by Māori for weaving and other crafts. Machaonia ottonis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ecological importance lies in its role as a habitat for various native insects and birds.
